definition: liter and decaliter dry measure/(fig.) meager quantity of foodstuff
to ascend/to rise to the rank of/to promote/to hoist/liter/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth dou 斗[dou3]
variant of 升[sheng1]/to ascend/to rise in rank
abbr. for the Big Dipper constellation 北斗星[Bei3 dou3 xing1]
to fight/to struggle/to condemn/to censure/to contend/to put together/coming together
dry measure for grain equal to ten 升[sheng1] or one-tenth of a 石[dan4]/decaliter/peck/cup or dipper shaped object/old variant of 陡[dou3]
poor people (idiom)/those who live from hand to mouth

sentences.english: Divers weights, [and] divers measures, both of them [are] alike abomination to the LORD.
sentences.chinese: 两样的法码，两样的升斗，都为耶和华所憎恶。

sentences.english: Thou shalt not have in thine house divers measures, a great and a small.
sentences.chinese: 你家里不可有一大一小两样的升斗。

definition: poor people (idiom)/those who live from hand to mouth
the beam of a steelyard/a balance arm
"the four classes" of ancient China, i.e. scholars, farmers, artisans, and merchants
rich and powerful/rich and influential person/big shot
